test_sync: This field should be added to all JSONs
_setup_instructions: IMPORTANT SETUP INSTRUCTIONS: 1. Replace all placeholder values marked with ${...}. 2. For each question in your assessment, add a corresponding category in questionRecommendations. 3. Ensure primaryCategory is set to your main scoring category. 4. Use the question's category name exactly as it appears in the questions section. 5. Each question should contribute to both its own category score and the primaryCategory score. 6. The paths in nextRoute should include the assessment ID (e.g., '/survey/your-assessment-id'). 7. Remove this _setup_instructions field when done.

intro.title: Neuro-Leadership Readiness Assessment
intro.subtitle: Evaluate if your leadership team would benefit from neuroscience-based leadership training

instructions.title: How to Complete This Assessment
steps: Answer each question based on your observations of leadership behaviors
Consider patterns across your entire leadership team
Focus on how leaders handle stress, decision-making, and team dynamics
Select the option that best describes typical leadership approaches

columns.title: Neuro-Leadership Framework
columns.content: Applying neuroscience principles to enhance leadership effectiveness and team performance

points.description: How leaders approach decision-making and problem-solving
How leaders manage emotions and relate to others
How leaders build and maintain team relationships
How leaders handle change and foster innovation

intro.consentText: I understand that this assessment will help determine if neuro-leadership training would benefit our leadership team

items.text: How do your leaders typically handle high-pressure situations?

options.text: Often become visibly stressed and transfer pressure to teams
Sometimes struggle to maintain composure under pressure
Handle pressure adequately but could improve responses
Generally maintain calm but occasional stress shows
Consistently demonstrate calm and focused leadership under pressure

items.text: How do your leaders approach complex decision-making?

options.text: Often make reactive decisions without considering long-term impacts
Tend to rely heavily on gut feelings without balanced analysis
Consider multiple factors but could improve systematic thinking
Usually make well-thought-out decisions with some consultation
Consistently use structured approaches combining analysis and intuition

items.text: How well do your leaders recognize and respond to team members' emotional states?

options.text: Rarely notice or address emotional dynamics in teams
Sometimes miss important emotional cues or respond inappropriately
Show moderate awareness but could improve responses
Generally aware and responsive to emotional needs
Highly attuned to emotional dynamics and respond effectively

items.text: How do your leaders handle organizational change?

options.text: Struggle to adapt and often resist necessary changes
Accept change but have difficulty leading others through it
Manage change adequately but could improve approach
Generally lead change well with some room for improvement
Effectively guide teams through change with clear vision

items.text: How open are your leaders to learning and applying new leadership approaches?

options.text: Resistant to new leadership concepts and methods
Sometimes skeptical of new approaches to leadership
Open to learning but may not actively seek development
Generally eager to learn and apply new concepts
Actively seek and implement new leadership insights

items.text: How effectively do your leaders create psychological safety in their teams?

options.text: Teams often feel unsafe expressing concerns or ideas
Inconsistent in creating safe spaces for open dialogue
Moderate level of psychological safety in teams
Generally good at fostering open communication
Excellent at creating environments of trust and safety

items.text: How do your leaders approach innovation and creative thinking?

options.text: Tend to stick to traditional approaches only
Sometimes consider new ideas but rarely implement them
Open to innovation but could be more proactive
Generally support and encourage creative thinking
Actively foster and implement innovative approaches

items.text: Has your leadership team received any neuroscience-based leadership training before?

options.text: No previous exposure to neuroscience-based leadership
Brief introduction but no formal training
Some leadership training but not neuroscience-focused
Previous neuro-leadership training but needs updating
Recent comprehensive neuro-leadership training

base: Understand the basic principles of neuroscience and their applications to leadership
Practice self-awareness techniques to monitor your own stress responses and emotional states
Learn to recognize cognitive biases in decision-making processes
Very High Need: Complete a comprehensive neuroleadership training program for your leadership team
Implement regular mindfulness practices to improve executive function and decision-making
Develop a neurologically-informed feedback system to optimize team communication
Create a psychological safety framework based on neuroleadership principles
High Need: Participate in focused neuroleadership workshops to understand brain-based leadership
Establish regular reflection practices that incorporate neuroscience principles
Redesign meeting structures to maximize cognitive engagement and minimize fatigue
Implement strategies to reduce threat responses in team interactions
Moderate Need: Enhance your understanding of how emotions affect decision-making through targeted learning
Refine your communication approach using neuroscience principles
Identify specific situations where cognitive bias affects your leadership
Strengthen team connections through brain-friendly collaboration techniques
Low Need: Fine-tune your neuro-leadership practices through advanced applications
Mentor others in applying neuroscience principles to leadership challenges
Develop customized approaches for complex leadership situations
Create organizational systems that support optimal brain functioning
Very Low Need: Lead initiatives to integrate neuroscience principles throughout your organization
Develop advanced applications of neuroleadership for specialized leadership contexts
Create training materials to help others understand brain-based leadership
Design strategic initiatives based on cutting-edge neuroscience research

primary_category.title: Neuro-Leadership Readiness
primary_category.description: Assessment of leadership team's preparedness for neuroscience-based approaches

high: Significant gaps in brain-based leadership understanding
Limited application of neuroscience principles in leadership
medium: Some awareness of neuroscience applications in leadership
Enhance existing neuroscience knowledge through targeted training
low: Share best practices across leadership team

secondary_category.title: Cognitive Leadership
secondary_category.description: Assessment of leadership decision-making and cognitive processing

high: Limited awareness of cognitive processing in leadership
medium: Some understanding of cognitive biases in decision-making
low: Strong cognitive awareness in leadership approach

high: Implement cognitive bias training for leadership team
medium: Enhance cognitive awareness through targeted exercises
low: Share cognitive best practices across organization

neuro_need.title: Neurological Leadership Readiness
neuro_need.description: Overall assessment of leadership team's neurological development needs

high: Leadership team shows significant gaps in neurological understanding
Current practices may not align with brain-based leadership principles
medium: Some understanding of neurological principles exists
Opportunities for enhancing brain-based leadership practices
low: Strong foundation in neurological leadership principles

medium: Enhance existing practices with neurological insights

stress_management.title: Stress Management Capability
stress_management.description: Assessment of team's ability to manage stress and emotional regulation

high: Limited emotional regulation strategies in place

report_structure.title: NeuroLeadership Development Plan
report_structure.description: Based on your leadership team's neuroscience-based assessment, we've created a comprehensive development plan focused on key neurological aspects of leadership:

critical_focus.title: Critical Focus Areas
critical_focus.description: These areas require immediate attention based on your assessment:

development_opportunities.title: Development Opportunities
development_opportunities.description: Areas showing moderate performance that can be enhanced:

implementation_strategy.title: Implementation Strategy
implementation_strategy.description: A structured approach to implementing these recommendations:
recommendations: Assessment & Baseline: Conduct detailed individual neuroscience-based leadership assessments
Skill Development: Implement targeted training programs in identified focus areas
Practice Integration: Create opportunities for applying neuroscience principles in daily leadership
Measurement & Feedback: Establish neurometric-based feedback mechanisms
Continuous Improvement: Regular review and adjustment of development activities

support_resources.title: Support Resources
support_resources.description: Resources and tools to support your development journey:
recommendations: Access to NeuroLeadership research and best practices library
Stress management and emotional regulation tools
Team development workshops incorporating latest neuroscience findings

Category Name.low: ${Replace with low priority recommendation for this category}

Another Category.low: ${Replace with low priority recommendation for this category}

primary_category.medium: ${Replace with medium priority recommendation for primary category}
primary_category.low: ${Replace with low priority recommendation for primary category}

category_example.high: High priority recommendation example for this category
category_example.medium: Medium priority recommendation example for this category
category_example.low: Low priority recommendation example for this category

primary_score.high: Primary high priority recommendation for overall assessment
primary_score.medium: Primary medium priority recommendation for overall assessment
primary_score.low: Primary low priority recommendation for overall assessment

Stress Management.high: Implement a comprehensive stress management program incorporating neuroscience-based techniques like mindfulness, cognitive reframing, and emotional regulation. Consider biofeedback training to help leaders recognize and manage their physiological stress responses.
Stress Management.medium: Introduce regular stress awareness workshops focusing on understanding the brain's stress response and practical techniques for maintaining composure. Practice scenario-based training for high-pressure situations.
Stress Management.low: Reinforce existing stress management practices with targeted neuroscience insights. Consider adding advanced techniques like stress-pattern recognition and proactive stress prevention strategies.

Decision Making.high: Establish a structured decision-making framework based on neuroscience principles, incorporating techniques for managing cognitive biases, emotional regulation, and systematic analysis. Implement regular decision-review processes.
Decision Making.medium: Enhance decision-making processes by introducing brain-based techniques for balancing analytical and intuitive thinking. Practice scenario planning and consequence mapping exercises.
Decision Making.low: Fine-tune existing decision-making approaches with advanced neuroscience concepts. Focus on optimizing group decision-making dynamics and long-term strategic thinking.

Emotional Intelligence.high: Begin intensive emotional intelligence development using neuroscience-based approaches. Focus on understanding neural mechanisms of emotion, developing stronger empathy, and practicing emotional regulation techniques.
Emotional Intelligence.medium: Enhance emotional awareness through structured practice of emotion recognition and response techniques. Implement regular feedback sessions focused on emotional intelligence in leadership.
Emotional Intelligence.low: Refine emotional intelligence skills with advanced concepts in social neuroscience. Focus on subtle emotional cues and complex team dynamics.

Change Management.high: Develop a comprehensive change management approach based on the brain's response to change. Focus on reducing resistance through neural pathway formation and creating psychological safety during transitions.
Change Management.medium: Strengthen change management capabilities by incorporating understanding of neuroplasticity and habit formation. Practice techniques for managing team anxiety during change.
Change Management.low: Optimize change management processes with advanced neuroscience insights about adaptation and resilience. Focus on creating sustainable change through brain-friendly approaches.

Learning Mindset.high: Create a structured program to develop a growth mindset based on neuroplasticity principles. Implement regular learning opportunities and celebrate learning attempts as much as successes.
Learning Mindset.medium: Enhance learning orientation by introducing concepts of brain malleability and the neuroscience of skill acquisition. Create safe spaces for experimentation and learning from mistakes.
Learning Mindset.low: Refine existing learning practices with advanced concepts in cognitive development and neural network formation. Focus on pushing beyond comfort zones while maintaining psychological safety.

Team Engagement.high: Implement comprehensive psychological safety initiatives based on social neuroscience principles. Focus on building trust through consistent behavior, transparent communication, and emotional validation.
Team Engagement.medium: Enhance team engagement through structured activities that build psychological safety. Practice techniques for creating brain-friendly environments that promote open dialogue.
Team Engagement.low: Optimize team dynamics with advanced concepts in social neuroscience. Focus on strengthening existing psychological safety practices and developing deeper trust.

Innovation.high: Establish an innovation framework based on creative thinking neuroscience. Implement regular ideation sessions using brain-based techniques for enhancing creativity and reducing fear of failure.
Innovation.medium: Enhance innovation practices by incorporating understanding of cognitive flexibility and divergent thinking. Create structured opportunities for creative exploration.
Innovation.low: Refine innovation processes with advanced neuroscience concepts about creativity and insight generation. Focus on optimizing conditions for breakthrough thinking.

Previous Training.high: Begin with foundational neuroscience concepts and gradually build to more advanced applications. Focus on practical implementation of brain-based leadership principles.
Previous Training.medium: Build upon existing knowledge by filling gaps in understanding and introducing new neuroscience applications in leadership.
Previous Training.low: Focus on advanced applications and latest developments in neuroscience-based leadership approaches. Share expertise with others in the organization.

needLevel.label: There is a very high chance your team could benefit from neuro-leadership training
There is a high chance your team could benefit from neuro-leadership training
There is a moderate chance your team could benefit from neuro-leadership training
There is a low chance your team could benefit from neuro-leadership training
There is a very low chance your team could benefit from neuro-leadership training

summaries.text: Your leadership team would significantly benefit from neuro-leadership training. Current approaches show opportunities for substantial improvement in brain-aware leadership practices.
Your leadership team shows clear need for neuro-leadership development. Training would help enhance decision-making, emotional intelligence, and team engagement.
Your leadership team demonstrates moderate need for neuro-leadership training. This would help refine existing practices and introduce new evidence-based approaches.
Your leadership team shows some effective practices but could benefit from additional neuro-leadership insights to optimize performance.
Your leadership team already demonstrates strong alignment with neuroscience-based leadership principles. Training on this is really not needed.

thankYou.title: Thank You for Completing the Neuro-Leadership Assessment!
thankYou.message: Based on your responses, we can provide insights about how neuroscience-based leadership training could benefit your organization. Understanding how the brain works can dramatically improve leadership effectiveness and team performance.
thankYou.nextSteps: We'll analyze your responses and send you personalized recommendations about how neuro-leadership training could address your specific needs. A specialist may reach out to discuss tailored training options.

scorecardInfo.title: Conflict Views
scorecardInfo.shortDescription: Evaluate if your team would benefit from conflict resolution training and mediation techniques
